data:
1
00:00:16,057 --> 00:00:18,351
First, there was darkness.

2
00:00:19,894 --> 00:00:22,772
Then came the Strangers.

3
00:00:22,772 --> 00:00:25,567
They were a race
as old as time itself.

4
00:00:26,651 --> 00:00:29,320
They had mastered
the ultimate technology--

5
00:00:29,362 --> 00:00:34,617
the ability to alter
physical reality by will alone.

6
00:00:34,659 --> 00:00:37,287
They called this ability
"Tuning."

7
00:00:38,455 --> 00:00:40,331
But they were dying.

8
00:00:40,373 --> 00:00:43,418
Their civilization was
in decline,

9
00:00:43,418 --> 00:00:46,171
and so they abandoned
their world,

10
00:00:46,254 --> 00:00:48,923
seeking a cure
for their own mortality.

11
00:00:50,300 --> 00:00:53,762
Their endless journey brought
them to a small, blue world...

12
00:00:53,803 --> 00:00:55,930
in the farthest corner
of the galaxy.

13
00:00:56,973 --> 00:00:58,433
Our world.

14
00:00:59,476 --> 00:01:01,478
Here, they thought
they had finally found...

15
00:01:01,519 --> 00:01:03,480
what they had been
searching for.

16
00:01:14,282 --> 00:01:17,160
My name is
Dr. Daniel Poe Schreber.

17
00:01:18,161 --> 00:01:19,829
I am just a man.

18
00:01:19,871 --> 00:01:22,665
I help the Strangers
conduct their experiments.

19
00:01:24,209 --> 00:01:26,336
I have betrayed my own kind.

20
00:04:53,918 --> 00:04:55,754
You are confused, aren't you?

21
00:04:55,795 --> 00:04:58,590
Frightened. That's all right.
I can help you.

22
00:04:58,590 --> 00:05:00,258
-Who is this?
-I'm a doctor.

23
00:05:00,300 --> 00:05:02,969
You must listen to me.
You have lost your memory.

24
00:05:03,011 --> 00:05:05,138
There was an experiment.
Something went wrong.

25
00:05:05,180 --> 00:05:07,349
Your memory was erased.
Do you understand me?

26
00:05:07,432 --> 00:05:09,476
No, I don't understand.
What's going on here?

27
00:05:09,517 --> 00:05:12,312
There are people coming for you
as we speak.

28
00:05:12,354 --> 00:05:14,647
Don't let them find you.
Leave now.

29
00:05:15,857 --> 00:05:18,026
Hello? Are you there?

30
00:06:00,235 --> 00:06:02,696
Hey, Mr. Murdoch,
the Automat called.

31
00:06:02,737 --> 00:06:04,239
Said you left your wallet there.

32
00:06:05,281 --> 00:06:08,910
I suggest you retrieve it, since
you only paid for three weeks,

33
00:06:08,952 --> 00:06:10,745
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

34
00:06:12,789 --> 00:06:14,290
I've been here three weeks?

35
00:06:14,290 --> 00:06:17,460
It's right there
in black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

36
00:06:17,502 --> 00:06:19,921
Day and date.

37
00:06:19,963 --> 00:06:23,258
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

38
00:06:23,299 --> 00:06:26,302
-I'll take care of it later.
-See that you do.

39
00:06:26,344 --> 00:06:28,471
Only thing makes you a guest
in this joint...

40
00:06:28,513 --> 00:06:29,931
is cash on the barrelhead!

41
00:06:47,824 --> 00:06:50,535
House rules.
Three weeks is three weeks.

42
00:06:50,577 --> 00:06:53,121
No days off for good behavior.

43
00:07:04,049 --> 00:07:07,719
Mr. Murdoch, yes?
Where is he?

44
00:07:07,719 --> 00:07:11,222
He just left
not five minutes ago.

45
00:07:12,557 --> 00:07:14,351
Sleep now.

46
00:07:16,936 --> 00:07:20,940
When the rumba rhythm
start to play

47
00:07:21,024 --> 00:07:23,193
Dance with me

48
00:07:23,234 --> 00:07:26,279
Make me sway

49
00:07:26,321 --> 00:07:30,283
Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore

50
00:07:30,325 --> 00:07:32,535
Hold me close

51
00:07:32,577 --> 00:07:35,455
Sway me more

52
00:07:35,455 --> 00:07:39,751
Like a flower bending
in the breeze

53
00:07:39,793 --> 00:07:42,253
Bend with me

54
00:07:42,253 --> 00:07:45,090
Sway with ease

55
00:07:45,131 --> 00:07:49,135
When we dance,
you have a way with me

56
00:07:49,135 --> 00:07:51,638
Stay with me

57
00:07:51,638 --> 00:07:54,182
Sway with me

58
00:07:54,974 --> 00:07:59,020
Hey, sweetie, he said he was
your husband's doctor.

59
00:07:59,104 --> 00:08:00,647
He wanted to speak with you.

60
00:08:20,875 --> 00:08:22,168
Excuse me.

61
00:08:24,087 --> 00:08:25,672
-Doctor...
-Schreber.

62
00:08:25,714 --> 00:08:29,718
Please, won't you come in?
You must be Emma Murdoch.

63
00:08:31,052 --> 00:08:34,514
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

64
00:08:34,556 --> 00:08:36,016
What is this?

65
00:08:36,057 --> 00:08:39,602
A rather crude experiment
designed to further my studies.

66
00:08:39,686 --> 00:08:43,356
I don't understand. You say
you're my husband's doctor,

67
00:08:43,398 --> 00:08:45,942
but he never
mentioned you to me.

68
00:08:45,984 --> 00:08:48,778
The truth is Mrs Murdoch, John has been
coming to see me...

69
00:08:48,820 --> 00:08:50,280
for quite some time.

70
00:08:50,280 --> 00:08:53,658
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

71
00:08:53,700 --> 00:08:56,745
stemming from
your marital difficulties.

72
00:08:56,786 --> 00:08:58,705
-John told you what happened.
-Yes.

73
00:09:00,081 --> 00:09:02,417
When was the last time
that you saw him?

74
00:09:02,417 --> 00:09:05,295
Three weeks ago.
He packed a suitcase.

75
00:09:05,337 --> 00:09:07,839
He was very angry at me.

76
00:09:07,922 --> 00:09:10,759
I understand how difficult
this must be for you,

77
00:09:10,800 --> 00:09:12,135
but for John's sake,

78
00:09:12,135 --> 00:09:15,138
I would like you to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

79
00:09:15,138 --> 00:09:18,808
It appears that John
has suffered a psychotic break.

80
00:09:18,808 --> 00:09:21,978
-Complete memory loss.
-You can't be serious.

81
00:09:22,020 --> 00:09:24,981
Oh, but I am.
He may be delusional.

82
00:09:25,023 --> 00:09:26,316
Even violent.

83
00:09:27,650 --> 00:09:31,613
If he were to contact you,
you must call me immediately.

84
00:09:31,654 --> 00:09:34,115
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

85
00:09:35,867 --> 00:09:37,077
For himself.

86
00:09:47,253 --> 00:09:51,174
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.
It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

87
00:09:52,092 --> 00:09:55,553
Mr. "J" something Murdoch?

88
00:09:58,890 --> 00:10:03,103
J. Murdoch. What's your name?
Justin? Jerry?

89
00:10:07,440 --> 00:10:09,526
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

90
00:10:09,567 --> 00:10:12,153
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

91
00:10:18,493 --> 00:10:20,245
Got to get a grip on myself.

92
00:10:44,352 --> 00:10:47,772
I told the guy,
cash on the barrelhead.

93
00:10:47,814 --> 00:10:51,109
I said, "Listen,
three weeks is three weeks."

94
00:10:51,151 --> 00:10:54,738
-Where's our lucky winner?
-Upstairs, sir. Room 614.

95
00:10:55,989 --> 00:10:57,323
The call girl.

96
00:11:01,953 --> 00:11:04,873
-Evening, Husselbeck.
-Inspector Bumstead.

97
00:11:04,873 --> 00:11:06,624
Your lace is untied.

98
00:11:07,876 --> 00:11:09,169
Sorry.

99
00:11:17,552 --> 00:11:19,179
Am I glad you're here, sir.

100
00:11:19,220 --> 00:11:21,848
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

101
00:11:21,890 --> 00:11:24,059
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

102
00:11:54,964 --> 00:11:57,509
-Thanks a lot.
-Excuse me.

103
00:11:59,969 --> 00:12:01,763
-Hello?
-Oh, it's you.

104
00:12:02,472 --> 00:12:05,141
-You left your wallet here buddy.
-When did I do that?

105
00:12:05,183 --> 00:12:07,435
-When you was last here.
-When was that?

106
00:12:07,477 --> 00:12:10,855
When you left your wallet.
Expect me to remember?

107
00:12:16,695 --> 00:12:19,447
-Excuse me!
-No, no, seriously.

108
00:12:36,840 --> 00:12:38,675
-Where you headed, chief?
-Home.

109
00:12:38,717 --> 00:12:40,051
And where's home?

110
00:12:40,051 --> 00:12:42,887
Haven't you mugs got
anything better to do?

111
00:12:42,887 --> 00:12:45,181
Wll I'm just trying to do my job, May.

112
00:12:45,223 --> 00:12:47,225
There's a killer out there in case you didnt noticed.

113
00:12:47,267 --> 00:12:49,936
Maybe you should be out looking for him
instead of cooling your heels.

114
00:12:53,273 --> 00:12:55,025
Go on. Get out of here.

115
00:13:03,950 --> 00:13:05,035
Come on.

116
00:13:08,288 --> 00:13:11,082
What's that make so far?
Six hookers in all?

117
00:13:11,082 --> 00:13:14,002
-I believe so, sir.
-Give the man an "A" for effort.

118
00:13:19,424 --> 00:13:21,760
So, Husselbeck,

119
00:13:21,801 --> 00:13:28,266
what kind of killer do you think
stops to save a dying fish?

120
00:13:28,308 --> 00:13:30,185
-Got me, sir.
-Bumstead.

121
00:13:30,185 --> 00:13:33,521
What took you? This killer's
been running circles around us,

122
00:13:33,521 --> 00:13:34,647
thanks to Walenski.

123
00:13:34,689 --> 00:13:36,483
With all due respect,
Chief lnspector,

124
00:13:36,524 --> 00:13:39,611
I've known Eddie a long time,
and he's a good cop.

125
00:13:39,652 --> 00:13:41,863
Whatever kind of cop
Walenski once was...

126
00:13:41,905 --> 00:13:43,823
he let drift a long time ago.

127
00:13:43,865 --> 00:13:45,658
Let me talk to Bumstead!

128
00:13:45,700 --> 00:13:47,744
Come on! Hold on!

129
00:13:48,411 --> 00:13:49,579
Frank!

130
00:13:52,665 --> 00:13:54,709
-Get his arm !
-They're watching us!

131
00:13:54,751 --> 00:13:57,003
-On your feet!
-There's no way out!

132
00:13:58,421 --> 00:14:00,173
God, can't you see?

133
00:14:03,551 --> 00:14:05,887
Let me go!
I'm not going to hurt you.

134
00:14:07,430 --> 00:14:09,683
-What was that?
-Walenski.

135
00:14:18,066 --> 00:14:21,194
I'm being punished
for my sins, right?

136
00:14:21,236 --> 00:14:25,573
What did I ever do to inherit
this? Where do you begin?

137
00:14:25,573 --> 00:14:28,535
Well, everything Detective
Walenski committed to paper...

138
00:14:28,576 --> 00:14:29,994
should be here, so--

139
00:14:30,036 --> 00:14:32,664
The only thing that should be
committed is Walenski.

140
00:14:34,958 --> 00:14:36,835
Nothing like
a little healthy paranoia.

141
00:14:43,425 --> 00:14:46,761
I came here to file a missing
persons report for my husband.

142
00:14:46,803 --> 00:14:50,181
-Take it to the front desk.
-They told me to come see you.

143
00:14:52,475 --> 00:14:54,144
His name's John Murdoch.

144
00:14:57,188 --> 00:15:00,525
Do these names mean
anything to you?

145
00:15:01,401 --> 00:15:03,361
Who are these women?

146
00:15:03,403 --> 00:15:05,280
Why are you looking
for my husband?

147
00:15:05,321 --> 00:15:07,574
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

148
00:15:07,615 --> 00:15:11,161
-Maybe. Maybe murder.
-Whose murder?

149
00:15:12,579 --> 00:15:15,832
-Which one?
-All of them.

150
00:15:17,250 --> 00:15:20,545
Mrs. Murdoch, I am sorry.
I didn't mean to alarm you.

151
00:15:20,587 --> 00:15:23,340
I'm sorry that I came.
I just made a mistake.

152
00:15:23,381 --> 00:15:27,177
If you'd please just give me
half a second to explain.

153
00:15:36,561 --> 00:15:37,771
We met before?

154
00:15:39,439 --> 00:15:42,525
If we did,
I hope you're still breathing.

155
00:15:42,567 --> 00:15:44,152
What's your name, honey?

156
00:15:47,906 --> 00:15:49,699
Well, that's
an appropriate name.

157
00:15:57,624 --> 00:15:58,917
I was just thinking.

158
00:16:03,129 --> 00:16:04,756
What you do...

159
00:16:05,924 --> 00:16:10,970
It seems kind of dangerous...
right now.

160
00:16:11,012 --> 00:16:12,972
I mean how do you know
I'm not the killer?

161
00:16:12,972 --> 00:16:16,267
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

162
00:16:17,185 --> 00:16:19,437
You feeling any urges
I should know about?

163
00:16:31,533 --> 00:16:32,701
Shoot.

164
00:17:20,415 --> 00:17:24,252
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

165
00:17:24,294 --> 00:17:28,089
-Who are you?
-We might ask the same question yes.

166
00:17:29,090 --> 00:17:31,343
Sleep...now.

167
00:17:56,910 --> 00:17:58,119
He can Tune!

168
00:18:51,339 --> 00:18:54,509
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

169
00:18:54,592 --> 00:18:57,679
-It is said he is able to Tune.
-Impossible!

170
00:18:57,762 --> 00:19:00,807
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

171
00:19:00,807 --> 00:19:03,685
On occasion, the imprinting
does not take.

172
00:19:03,685 --> 00:19:06,271
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

173
00:19:06,312 --> 00:19:09,983
We find them wandering
like lost children.

174
00:19:10,025 --> 00:19:12,152
But this one was different, yes?

175
00:19:12,193 --> 00:19:15,947
-What has the doctor to say about this?
-He has failed to report in.

176
00:19:15,989 --> 00:19:19,117
-And Mr. Quick?
-No more Mr. Quick.

177
00:19:19,159 --> 00:19:21,786
Mr. Quick...dead, yes.

178
00:19:25,165 --> 00:19:27,834
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

179
00:19:27,834 --> 00:19:30,754
Mr. Book...does he know?

180
00:19:31,755 --> 00:19:33,840
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

181
00:19:34,841 --> 00:19:37,719
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

182
00:19:37,761 --> 00:19:40,722
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

183
00:19:40,722 --> 00:19:43,016
We must have this man.

184
00:19:48,938 --> 00:19:50,106
My brand, I hope.

185
00:20:02,452 --> 00:20:04,037
I've been soo worried about you.

186
00:20:08,083 --> 00:20:09,417
Are you punishing me?

187
00:20:10,168 --> 00:20:12,796
If disappearing is
your way of punishing me,

188
00:20:12,837 --> 00:20:14,089
I don't appreciate it.

189
00:20:14,089 --> 00:20:15,256
I don't what are you talking about?

190
00:20:18,802 --> 00:20:22,597
I found these keys in my pocket,
so I assume I live here.

191
00:20:24,766 --> 00:20:27,102
-You supposed to be my wife?
-"Supposed to be"?

192
00:20:30,647 --> 00:20:34,651
You really...don't know
who I am, do you.

193
00:20:35,527 --> 00:20:38,321
Your doctor called me. He was
worried that this might happen.

194
00:20:38,321 --> 00:20:39,656
My doctor?

195
00:20:42,575 --> 00:20:46,287
He gave me his card.
He's desperate to find you.

196
00:20:54,045 --> 00:20:56,047
Feel like I'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

197
00:20:56,089 --> 00:20:58,883
What happened to me?
Why was I seeing a doctor?

198
00:20:59,509 --> 00:21:01,011
I had an affair.

199
00:21:02,887 --> 00:21:04,222
You were angry at me.

200
00:21:07,392 --> 00:21:11,104
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

201
00:21:20,822 --> 00:21:23,158
Most unfortunate it is...

202
00:21:23,199 --> 00:21:25,493
that we were forced
to seek you out here.

203
00:21:26,453 --> 00:21:30,623
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this moisture.

204
00:21:31,499 --> 00:21:34,794
-I'm sorry. I--
-Failed to report in, yes?

205
00:21:34,836 --> 00:21:37,797
I was frightened.
I have a weak heart, you know.

206
00:21:37,797 --> 00:21:41,343
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

207
00:21:41,426 --> 00:21:44,095
We found this in his hotel room.

208
00:21:44,137 --> 00:21:47,640
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

209
00:21:47,640 --> 00:21:49,809
I tried to reprint him,
but he woke up.

210
00:21:49,851 --> 00:21:52,020
He knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

211
00:21:52,103 --> 00:21:55,315
-He has no memories, then?
-Only fragments.

212
00:21:55,315 --> 00:21:56,858
The procedure,
it was interrupted.

213
00:21:56,858 --> 00:21:59,611
I guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

214
00:22:00,362 --> 00:22:02,072
You have had strays
before, right?

215
00:22:02,113 --> 00:22:05,992
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can Tune.

216
00:22:05,992 --> 00:22:09,079
But that's impossible.
Only you have that ability.

217
00:22:09,120 --> 00:22:11,414
You will process
another template...

218
00:22:11,456 --> 00:22:13,500
of the subject's memories, yes?

219
00:22:13,541 --> 00:22:15,168
Of course.
I'll imprint him again.

220
00:22:16,711 --> 00:22:20,006
We require them
for a quite different purpose.

221
00:22:20,006 --> 00:22:22,842
It's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

222
00:22:22,842 --> 00:22:24,719
We'll talk again
after tonight's Tuning,

223
00:22:24,719 --> 00:22:27,681
but no more delays, yes?

224
00:22:27,722 --> 00:22:32,519
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

225
00:22:34,396 --> 00:22:36,064
The police were looking for you.

226
00:22:36,064 --> 00:22:38,233
I know. I saw the papers.

227
00:22:38,274 --> 00:22:40,777
"Killer stalks
city street-walkers."

228
00:22:44,406 --> 00:22:46,700
I was with one of those women.

229
00:22:48,243 --> 00:22:51,663
-Before I came here tonight.
-I don't understand.

230
00:22:51,705 --> 00:22:56,626
I met her outside an Automat.
I guess I wanted to test myself.

231
00:22:58,336 --> 00:23:01,756
I wanted to know if I had it
in me to do those things.

232
00:23:01,756 --> 00:23:03,258
Maybe I have lost my mind,

233
00:23:03,299 --> 00:23:06,302
but whoever I am, I'm still me,
and I'm not a killer.

234
00:23:12,308 --> 00:23:13,685
I believe you.

235
00:23:15,520 --> 00:23:16,771
You do?

236
00:23:21,317 --> 00:23:23,319
-What?
-The car outside.

237
00:23:23,361 --> 00:23:24,821
The one you arrived in.

238
00:23:24,863 --> 00:23:27,157
It's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

239
00:23:29,325 --> 00:23:31,077
I didn't know he was still here.

240
00:23:34,664 --> 00:23:36,124
Hold it right there, mister!

241
00:23:38,543 --> 00:23:41,546
-Wait. You have the wrong man.
-Stand aside, will you, please?

242
00:23:41,588 --> 00:23:43,048
I didn't kill anyone.

243
00:23:43,089 --> 00:23:45,383
Right now,
all you are is a suspect.

244
00:23:45,425 --> 00:23:48,678
Turn yourself in. I'll listen
to whatever you have to say.

245
00:23:48,720 --> 00:23:50,764
You won't believe
what I have to say.

246
00:23:51,890 --> 00:23:55,226
-Try me.
-There's someone after me.

247
00:23:55,226 --> 00:23:58,897
It's this group of men.
They want me dead.

248
00:23:58,897 --> 00:24:01,775
And I don't even know if...
they're not even--

249
00:24:01,775 --> 00:24:04,027
Yeah, who's going to listen
to a madman?

250
00:24:04,069 --> 00:24:06,571
-Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.
-Run!

251
00:24:10,909 --> 00:24:12,869
No one ever listens to me.

252
00:24:19,167 --> 00:24:20,251
Murdoch, stop!

253
00:25:03,169 --> 00:25:05,505
-How much further?
-We're almost there, buddy.

254
00:25:09,009 --> 00:25:11,386
You happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

255
00:25:11,428 --> 00:25:14,514
You're kidding! Me and the wife
spent our honeymoon there.

256
00:25:14,556 --> 00:25:17,058
All you do is
take Main Street West to...

257
00:25:20,061 --> 00:25:23,273
Or is it the Cross...
Now, that's funny.

258
00:25:23,356 --> 00:25:26,443
I can't seem to remember
if it's Main Street West...

259
00:25:26,526 --> 00:25:27,819
or the Crosstown.

260
00:25:32,490 --> 00:25:35,535
I'm sorry, lnspector,
I cannot be of more assistance,

261
00:25:35,618 --> 00:25:37,579
but I am running late
for an appointment.

262
00:25:37,620 --> 00:25:39,748
Well, I appreciate you
taking the time.

263
00:25:48,465 --> 00:25:50,925
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

264
00:25:50,925 --> 00:25:55,472
I've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

265
00:25:55,513 --> 00:25:58,266
Murdoch doesn't
strike me as one.

266
00:25:58,308 --> 00:26:01,478
Perhaps you are not accustomed
to digging deep enough.

267
00:26:01,519 --> 00:26:04,356
Well, I do know when
someone is lying to me, Doctor.

268
00:26:04,439 --> 00:26:08,651
Inspector, judging personalities
happens to be my business.

269
00:26:08,651 --> 00:26:10,653
Maybe you can give me
a few pointers.

270
00:26:10,695 --> 00:26:14,657
Certainly.
Let's take you, for instance.

271
00:26:14,699 --> 00:26:17,786
You are a fastidious man.
Driven.

272
00:26:17,869 --> 00:26:20,121
Consumed by details.

273
00:26:20,163 --> 00:26:23,667
I would say
your life is rather lonely.

274
00:26:23,708 --> 00:26:26,336
Good evening, lnspector.
I really must be going.

275
00:27:04,124 --> 00:27:05,208
Come in.

276
00:27:10,255 --> 00:27:12,007
-How is he?
-The same.

277
00:27:13,299 --> 00:27:15,969
Walenski? It's me, Frank.

278
00:27:22,308 --> 00:27:23,518
Come in, Frank.

279
00:27:26,813 --> 00:27:28,023
Close the door.

280
00:27:36,072 --> 00:27:39,367
I've been looking through
some of your old reports.

281
00:27:39,409 --> 00:27:41,494
It's an interesting case.

282
00:27:42,620 --> 00:27:45,832
Kind that make a man's career.

283
00:27:47,542 --> 00:27:51,171
-Or break it.
-Yeah. I was on that case.

284
00:27:51,212 --> 00:27:55,050
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

285
00:27:55,091 --> 00:27:56,509
Nothing happened, Frank.

286
00:27:57,552 --> 00:27:59,554
I've just been spending time
in the subway,

287
00:27:59,596 --> 00:28:01,556
riding in circles.

288
00:28:01,556 --> 00:28:05,101
Thinking in circles.
There's no way out.

289
00:28:07,395 --> 00:28:09,064
I've been over this entire city.

290
00:28:13,568 --> 00:28:15,445
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

291
00:28:15,487 --> 00:28:16,988
She's not my wife.

292
00:28:18,823 --> 00:28:21,785
I don't know who she is
or who any of us are.

293
00:28:21,826 --> 00:28:25,205
-What makes you say that?
-You think about the past much?

294
00:28:27,248 --> 00:28:28,750
As much as the next guy.

295
00:28:29,751 --> 00:28:32,504
See, I've been trying
to remember things--

296
00:28:32,587 --> 00:28:35,632
clearly remember things
from my past.

297
00:28:35,674 --> 00:28:37,842
But the more
I try to think back,

298
00:28:37,926 --> 00:28:40,929
the more it all starts
to unravel.

299
00:28:40,970 --> 00:28:42,138
None of it seems real.

300
00:28:42,138 --> 00:28:46,309
It's like I've just
been dreaming this life,

301
00:28:46,309 --> 00:28:49,312
and when I finally wake up,
I'll be somebody else,

302
00:28:49,354 --> 00:28:51,356
somebody totally different.

303
00:28:55,735 --> 00:28:57,904
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie.

304
00:28:59,030 --> 00:29:01,574
Something to do with the case.

305
00:29:02,158 --> 00:29:05,537
There is no case!
There never was!

306
00:29:05,578 --> 00:29:09,499
It's all just a big joke!
It's a joke!

307
00:29:50,582 --> 00:29:52,334
Tonight's requirements are...

308
00:29:52,375 --> 00:29:55,628
12 family photo albums,

309
00:29:55,670 --> 00:29:58,089
nine personal diaries,

310
00:29:58,131 --> 00:30:00,258
17 love letters,

311
00:30:00,300 --> 00:30:02,761
assorted childhood photographs,

312
00:30:02,802 --> 00:30:06,973
requisite false l.D.s
and social security cards.

313
00:30:06,973 --> 00:30:09,309
These do bring back memories.

314
00:30:11,644 --> 00:30:13,938
This one is still warm.

315
00:30:14,689 --> 00:30:15,857
What is it?

316
00:30:15,857 --> 00:30:19,110
The recollections of
a great lover?

317
00:30:19,152 --> 00:30:21,446
A catalogue of conquests?

318
00:30:22,155 --> 00:30:23,656
We will soon find out.

319
00:30:24,949 --> 00:30:26,451
You wouldn't
appreciate that,

320
00:30:26,493 --> 00:30:29,704
would you,
Mr. Whatever-your-name is?

321
00:30:29,746 --> 00:30:34,042
Not the sort of conquest
you would ever understand.

322
00:30:34,834 --> 00:30:36,169
Let's see.

323
00:30:37,420 --> 00:30:40,173
A touch of
unhappy childhood...

324
00:30:45,845 --> 00:30:48,390
A dash of
teenage rebellion...

325
00:30:50,016 --> 00:30:53,103
And last but not least...

326
00:30:53,103 --> 00:30:55,730
a tragic death
in the family.

327
00:30:58,566 --> 00:31:00,235
Mr. Book.

328
00:31:07,242 --> 00:31:10,829
Why does Murdoch not sleep
during the Tuning?

329
00:31:10,870 --> 00:31:15,125
Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

330
00:31:15,166 --> 00:31:16,376
A freak of nature.

331
00:31:16,418 --> 00:31:19,254
He's adapting to survive.
What do you expect?

332
00:31:19,295 --> 00:31:21,256
Weren't you looking for
the human soul?

333
00:31:21,256 --> 00:31:23,925
Isn't that the purpose
of your little zoo?

334
00:31:23,925 --> 00:31:27,303
That's why you change people
and things every night.

335
00:31:27,303 --> 00:31:30,181
Maybe you have finally
found what you are looking for,

336
00:31:30,265 --> 00:31:31,808
and it's going to bite you
on your--

337
00:31:35,854 --> 00:31:37,772
It requires several
of your lifetimes...

338
00:31:37,814 --> 00:31:39,482
to master our gifts.

339
00:31:39,524 --> 00:31:41,317
The idea that
a simple man...

340
00:31:41,359 --> 00:31:43,361
could develop the ability
to Tune is--

341
00:31:43,403 --> 00:31:44,529
Absurd, I know.

342
00:31:44,571 --> 00:31:46,865
What other explanation is there?

343
00:31:51,828 --> 00:31:52,996
It is time.

344
00:32:38,958 --> 00:32:40,418
Shut it down.

345
00:32:58,978 --> 00:33:02,107
Fredrickson says he'll take me
off the night shift.

346
00:33:02,148 --> 00:33:03,983
It's about time, dear.

347
00:33:54,784 --> 00:33:55,785
Hello?

348
00:34:04,085 --> 00:34:05,420
Wake up.

349
00:34:08,590 --> 00:34:10,091
Wake up!

350
00:34:20,143 --> 00:34:22,312
Can anyone hear me?

351
00:34:25,482 --> 00:34:28,318
Let the Tuning commence.

352
00:37:08,311 --> 00:37:09,688
The Goodwins.

353
00:37:09,688 --> 00:37:11,690
Charlie, Sylvia,

354
00:37:11,773 --> 00:37:13,858
Jane, and little Matthew.

355
00:37:17,737 --> 00:37:19,948
Jane and little Matthew.

356
00:37:50,103 --> 00:37:52,397
The rich get richer.

357
00:37:52,439 --> 00:37:54,524
Probably have
maid's quarters...

358
00:37:54,607 --> 00:37:55,942
before the night
is through.

359
00:38:49,537 --> 00:38:51,498
Dr. Schreber, I presume.

360
00:38:51,539 --> 00:38:53,041
It's you.

361
00:38:53,083 --> 00:38:54,125
Hey, come on.

362
00:38:54,167 --> 00:38:56,336
That's no way to greet
a patient, Doctor,

363
00:38:56,336 --> 00:38:58,505
if that's what you are.

364
00:38:58,505 --> 00:39:00,006
Please, l--

365
00:39:00,006 --> 00:39:01,841
Why is everyone asleep?

366
00:39:01,883 --> 00:39:04,260
Please keep your voice down.

367
00:39:04,344 --> 00:39:06,221
I can't remember anything.
What have you done?

368
00:39:06,262 --> 00:39:09,057
Nothing. I want to help you.

369
00:39:09,099 --> 00:39:12,560
We cannot talk here.
If they see us together--

370
00:39:12,602 --> 00:39:15,438
I don't care.
I want some answers. Now!

371
00:39:15,522 --> 00:39:18,608
Who are they?
Why are they trying to kill me?

372
00:39:18,692 --> 00:39:19,776
Answer me!

373
00:39:24,906 --> 00:39:25,949
My God.

374
00:39:25,990 --> 00:39:29,035
-You really can do it.
-I did that?

375
00:39:29,077 --> 00:39:31,705
Listen to me.
You have their power.

376
00:39:31,746 --> 00:39:33,707
You can make things happen
by will alone.

377
00:39:33,748 --> 00:39:35,333
They call it "Tuning."

378
00:39:35,375 --> 00:39:37,335
That is how they change
the buildings.

379
00:39:37,419 --> 00:39:39,921
Just now you acted
out of self-defense,

380
00:39:39,963 --> 00:39:42,757
but I can teach you
to control your power.

381
00:39:42,757 --> 00:39:46,761
We can stop them.
We can take the city back.

382
00:39:50,098 --> 00:39:51,599
My glasses.

383
00:40:45,862 --> 00:40:48,198
He made a terrible impression
for the firm,

384
00:40:48,239 --> 00:40:51,076
Iollygagging around
as he did.

385
00:40:51,117 --> 00:40:53,995
So I told Fredrickson
I was letting him go.

386
00:40:54,037 --> 00:40:56,039
Well you should have, darling.

387
00:40:56,748 --> 00:40:59,834
He attacked me.
I don't know where he's gone.

388
00:41:00,335 --> 00:41:04,297
Come, Dr. Schreber.
We have much to do.

389
00:41:04,339 --> 00:41:06,925
-Yes?
-Yes.

390
00:41:09,344 --> 00:41:15,809
They say that
you're a runaround lover

391
00:41:16,851 --> 00:41:24,943
Though you say it isn't so

392
00:41:27,821 --> 00:41:34,661
But if you put me down
for another

393
00:41:36,287 --> 00:41:42,168
I'll know, believe me, I'll know

394
00:41:43,670 --> 00:41:47,173
Tonight's experiment will
take place in these locations.

395
00:41:47,173 --> 00:41:51,219
The first subject
shall be imprinted on Avenue M.

396
00:41:51,261 --> 00:41:54,264
Mr. Book, there is a problem.

397
00:41:54,347 --> 00:41:55,890
There is no Avenue M.

398
00:41:55,932 --> 00:41:57,851
We were unable
to complete it.

399
00:41:57,892 --> 00:42:01,354
During the last Tuning,
we detected a lack of control.

400
00:42:01,396 --> 00:42:04,607
An opposing influence
on the machines?

401
00:42:04,691 --> 00:42:08,903
This man Murdoch is
more powerful than we thought.

402
00:42:08,945 --> 00:42:10,905
He is becoming like us.

403
00:42:10,905 --> 00:42:14,367
So we must become like him.

404
00:42:15,285 --> 00:42:17,620
The doctor has done as we asked?

405
00:42:17,662 --> 00:42:21,374
The life and times
of John Murdoch, volume two.

406
00:42:23,376 --> 00:42:25,962
We must not do this.

407
00:42:26,004 --> 00:42:29,424
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

408
00:42:29,424 --> 00:42:32,260
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

409
00:42:32,302 --> 00:42:35,764
Everywhere he goes,
everyone he seeks out...

410
00:42:35,805 --> 00:42:37,015
will be known to us.

411
00:42:37,098 --> 00:42:42,187
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

412
00:42:42,270 --> 00:42:44,689
But to imprint one of us?

413
00:42:44,689 --> 00:42:47,442
Failure has always resulted.

414
00:42:47,484 --> 00:42:51,029
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

415
00:42:51,071 --> 00:42:52,697
Imprint.

416
00:42:58,119 --> 00:43:00,038
This may sting a bit.

417
00:43:36,574 --> 00:43:38,284
Is it done?

418
00:43:38,326 --> 00:43:40,745
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

419
00:43:40,787 --> 00:43:44,624
I have John Murdoch in mind.

420
00:43:45,291 --> 00:43:46,876
"Johnny...

421
00:43:46,918 --> 00:43:50,922
"Found this postcard
among your mother's things.

422
00:43:50,964 --> 00:43:53,258
"Brings back memories,
doesn't it?

423
00:43:53,258 --> 00:43:55,093
"Stop by sometime.

424
00:43:55,135 --> 00:43:58,471
"We'll see if we can't
hook ourselves another mermaid.

425
00:43:58,471 --> 00:44:00,807
"Love to Emma. Karl."

426
00:44:06,312 --> 00:44:07,272
Karl.

427
00:44:09,149 --> 00:44:10,817
Karl Harris.

428
00:44:18,992 --> 00:44:20,035
Harris.

429
00:44:28,335 --> 00:44:31,379
Excuse me.
Which way is Avenue C?

430
00:44:31,421 --> 00:44:32,672
Try the subway.

431
00:44:36,384 --> 00:44:37,886
You got a problem, pal?

432
00:44:37,927 --> 00:44:40,764
Been working here long?

433
00:44:40,847 --> 00:44:44,184
25 years.
No days off for good behavior.

434
00:45:09,334 --> 00:45:12,253
We're looking for John Murdoch.

435
00:45:46,538 --> 00:45:48,623
She knows nothing,
Mr. Hand.

436
00:45:48,665 --> 00:45:50,500
A dead end, Mr. Wall.

437
00:45:50,542 --> 00:45:53,336
We thought his imprint
would let us track him.

438
00:45:53,336 --> 00:45:55,839
But instead
we have been brought here.

439
00:45:55,880 --> 00:45:59,926
-This is irrational.
-Instincts are irrational.

440
00:46:00,010 --> 00:46:03,263
We must follow
where they lead, yes?

441
00:46:03,346 --> 00:46:06,558
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar.

442
00:46:06,599 --> 00:46:07,934
His job.

443
00:46:08,018 --> 00:46:10,061
He does not care about our job.

444
00:46:10,061 --> 00:46:12,897
Indulge us, Mr. Hand.

445
00:46:12,939 --> 00:46:15,608
If you were Murdoch, yes?

446
00:46:15,608 --> 00:46:18,987
If I were Murdoch...

447
00:46:20,780 --> 00:46:24,284
I would remember how
my wife had hurt me...

448
00:46:24,325 --> 00:46:26,369
by sleeping with another man.

449
00:46:27,912 --> 00:46:29,414
And then...

450
00:46:31,332 --> 00:46:34,753
I would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

451
00:46:37,756 --> 00:46:42,344
Leave me alone with her.
There's work to be done.

452
00:46:46,014 --> 00:46:48,141
All change,
platform three.

453
00:46:50,810 --> 00:46:51,936
All change?

454
00:46:51,978 --> 00:46:54,314
Excuse me, how do I get
to the end of the line?

455
00:46:54,314 --> 00:46:55,815
You want the Express.

456
00:47:08,411 --> 00:47:10,872
How come the train didn't stop?

457
00:47:10,914 --> 00:47:12,207
That's the Express.

458
00:47:13,750 --> 00:47:15,669
There's no way out.

459
00:47:15,710 --> 00:47:18,505
You can't get out of the city.
I've tried.

460
00:47:19,673 --> 00:47:21,716
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

461
00:47:21,758 --> 00:47:23,426
The one
they've been looking for.

462
00:47:23,510 --> 00:47:24,594
You're not a killer.

463
00:47:24,678 --> 00:47:27,389
They set you up with
a fake identity,

464
00:47:27,389 --> 00:47:29,057
Iike everyone else here.

465
00:47:29,057 --> 00:47:31,017
-Who are you?
-I was a cop.

466
00:47:31,059 --> 00:47:34,187
At least in this life I was.

467
00:47:34,229 --> 00:47:37,065
They steal peoples' memories.

468
00:47:37,107 --> 00:47:38,900
Then they swap them around
between us.

469
00:47:38,942 --> 00:47:41,653
I seen them do it,
back and forth...

470
00:47:41,695 --> 00:47:43,822
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

471
00:47:43,863 --> 00:47:45,156
How do you know all this?

472
00:47:45,198 --> 00:47:46,991
Once in a while one of us
wakes up...

473
00:47:47,033 --> 00:47:48,451
while they're changing things.

474
00:47:49,369 --> 00:47:51,871
It's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

475
00:47:51,913 --> 00:47:53,248
It happened to me.

476
00:47:53,915 --> 00:47:55,834
They'll come looking for you.

477
00:47:56,960 --> 00:47:59,295
Just like they'll come
looking for me.

478
00:47:59,337 --> 00:48:00,755
But that's OK.

479
00:48:00,755 --> 00:48:02,007
I figured a way out.

480
00:48:13,476 --> 00:48:14,686
They were here.

481
00:48:16,813 --> 00:48:18,189
Last night.

482
00:48:18,273 --> 00:48:20,483
This was to be his home.

483
00:48:23,153 --> 00:48:24,946
That was when we loved her.

484
00:48:24,988 --> 00:48:27,323
This is all well and good,

485
00:48:27,365 --> 00:48:29,367
but we require
a more practical link...

486
00:48:29,409 --> 00:48:31,453
to his present whereabouts.

487
00:48:36,082 --> 00:48:38,126
And I know where to find her.

488
00:48:46,551 --> 00:48:49,888
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

489
00:48:49,888 --> 00:48:50,930
I'm sorry?

490
00:48:51,014 --> 00:48:53,058
To be able to revisit
those places...

491
00:48:53,058 --> 00:48:55,060
which meant
so very much to us.

492
00:48:55,894 --> 00:48:58,438
I thought we were haunted
by them.

493
00:48:58,521 --> 00:49:00,231
Perhaps.

494
00:49:00,273 --> 00:49:02,734
There used to be a ferry
when I was a boy.

495
00:49:02,776 --> 00:49:04,861
Biggest thing you ever saw.

496
00:49:04,903 --> 00:49:07,739
Lit up like
a floating birthday cake.

497
00:49:09,115 --> 00:49:11,701
That's just what my husband
once said to me.

498
00:49:11,743 --> 00:49:13,286
On this very spot.

499
00:49:14,788 --> 00:49:16,873
Where is your husband now?

500
00:49:16,915 --> 00:49:20,752
I wish I knew.
What brings you here?

501
00:49:20,752 --> 00:49:23,630
I met my wife at this place.

502
00:49:23,672 --> 00:49:25,924
It's where I met my husband.

503
00:49:25,965 --> 00:49:27,467
Small world.

504
00:50:21,688 --> 00:50:22,689
Hello?

505
00:51:10,070 --> 00:51:11,946
What are you doing here?

506
00:51:11,988 --> 00:51:13,615
I've been following you.

507
00:51:17,535 --> 00:51:19,245
Hold it right there!

508
00:51:21,331 --> 00:51:22,290
Johnny?

509
00:51:25,418 --> 00:51:26,711
It's been so damn long,

510
00:51:26,753 --> 00:51:28,880
I thought you'd forgotten
your Uncle Karl.

511
00:51:30,090 --> 00:51:31,508
You son of a gun!

512
00:51:34,928 --> 00:51:36,179
Uncle Karl...

513
00:51:39,224 --> 00:51:40,225
Wait.

514
00:51:43,103 --> 00:51:45,271
-Is that me?
-Yeah.

515
00:51:53,571 --> 00:51:55,323
Shell Beach is where
I grew up?

516
00:51:55,365 --> 00:51:57,992
That's what I said.
Shell Beach.

517
00:51:58,034 --> 00:52:00,453
-Your home town.
-I need to get there.

518
00:52:00,495 --> 00:52:01,538
How do I get there?

519
00:52:02,956 --> 00:52:05,875
I don't know.
I haven't been there in years.

520
00:52:05,917 --> 00:52:08,795
You must remember.
You must have some idea.

521
00:52:10,755 --> 00:52:12,007
Sorry, Johnny.

522
00:52:13,425 --> 00:52:15,969
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

523
00:52:19,806 --> 00:52:23,268
-It was so bright there.
-Brighter times, I guess.

524
00:52:25,020 --> 00:52:28,314
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

525
00:52:28,356 --> 00:52:30,316
That's me and your Pa.

526
00:52:30,358 --> 00:52:32,694
What a couple of
handsome fools.

527
00:52:32,694 --> 00:52:34,279
What happened to my parents?

528
00:52:36,823 --> 00:52:37,949
Where are they now?

529
00:52:39,200 --> 00:52:40,994
They're dead, Johnny.

530
00:52:41,036 --> 00:52:43,788
They died when the house
burned down.

531
00:52:43,830 --> 00:52:45,457
I looked after you.

532
00:52:46,374 --> 00:52:48,126
You don't remember that,
really?

533
00:52:51,004 --> 00:52:53,506
What's that? What is that?

534
00:52:59,346 --> 00:53:01,222
It's a scar.

535
00:53:01,222 --> 00:53:03,558
You burned your arm pretty bad
in the fire.

536
00:53:09,105 --> 00:53:10,690
What does it mean?

537
00:53:10,732 --> 00:53:12,734
It means these are all lies!

538
00:53:16,821 --> 00:53:19,157
My husband told me
he'd been here.

539
00:53:19,199 --> 00:53:21,993
He told me he wanted
to test himself.

540
00:53:22,035 --> 00:53:24,329
See if he was...

541
00:53:24,371 --> 00:53:26,706
capable of...

542
00:53:35,590 --> 00:53:37,425
I wanted to talk to her.

543
00:53:37,467 --> 00:53:39,427
I thought she could
help me find him.

544
00:53:41,137 --> 00:53:43,139
I'm going to call the station.

545
00:53:59,322 --> 00:54:00,573
It's beautiful.

546
00:54:03,243 --> 00:54:06,079
It was a gift from my mother.

547
00:54:06,121 --> 00:54:07,664
She died recently.

548
00:54:09,040 --> 00:54:11,334
I keep it with me
to remind me of her.

549
00:54:13,503 --> 00:54:14,504
I'm sorry.

550
00:54:18,174 --> 00:54:20,343
It's a funny thing, though.

551
00:54:20,343 --> 00:54:22,846
I can't remember
when she gave it to me.

552
00:54:25,265 --> 00:54:27,726
How do you think I could
forget a thing like that?

553
00:54:29,227 --> 00:54:31,688
What's happening, lnspector?

554
00:54:31,730 --> 00:54:33,523
I'm not sure I know anymore.

555
00:54:37,527 --> 00:54:39,279
I left your old room
like it was.

556
00:54:40,321 --> 00:54:42,574
You can sleep here tonight.

557
00:54:42,615 --> 00:54:44,743
Glad to have you back, Johnny.

558
00:54:44,743 --> 00:54:47,537
-Even if it is for just a night.
-Karl.

559
00:54:48,663 --> 00:54:51,332
-Is that the right time?
-Why, sure.

560
00:54:51,374 --> 00:54:53,793
That clock's kept perfect time
since I bought it.

561
00:54:53,835 --> 00:54:55,170
A.M. or P.M.?

562
00:54:56,838 --> 00:54:59,257
-What do you think?
-I don't understand.

563
00:54:59,257 --> 00:55:02,093
How can it be night already?
What happened to the day?

564
00:55:02,093 --> 00:55:04,637
You're tired.
Anything's possible.

565
00:55:06,306 --> 00:55:07,307
Get some sleep.

566
00:55:07,307 --> 00:55:09,809
We'll straighten all this out
tomorrow.

567
00:55:41,925 --> 00:55:43,176
Come on...

568
00:56:03,613 --> 00:56:06,616
He's here.
He's acting peculiar.

569
00:56:06,658 --> 00:56:09,035
I know. He's not himself.

570
00:56:09,077 --> 00:56:11,121
Keep him there,
and I'll be right over.

571
00:56:11,162 --> 00:56:13,415
-I'll try.
-Thanks. Bye.

572
00:56:16,960 --> 00:56:20,338
I can't promise anything.
We'll play it as it comes.

573
00:56:21,089 --> 00:56:23,925
We just wanted to help.

574
00:56:30,640 --> 00:56:34,310
Karl. Uncle Karl.

575
00:56:34,310 --> 00:56:37,814
If you're in trouble,
maybe we can do something.

576
00:56:39,274 --> 00:56:41,776
Haven't seen you in so long.

577
00:57:56,434 --> 00:58:01,106
Mr. Murdoch, you've been
the cause of much distress.

578
00:58:05,944 --> 00:58:08,321
-Start talking.
-There's no need for this.

579
00:58:08,363 --> 00:58:11,950
There's no escape.
The city's ours. We made it.

580
00:58:11,991 --> 00:58:13,326
What are you talking about?

581
00:58:13,368 --> 00:58:16,454
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories.

582
00:58:16,496 --> 00:58:20,250
Different eras, different pasts,
all rolled into one.

583
00:58:20,291 --> 00:58:24,337
Each night we revise it,
refine it, in order to learn.

584
00:58:24,379 --> 00:58:27,424
-Learn what?
-About you.

585
00:58:27,507 --> 00:58:31,886
You and your fellow inhabitants.
What makes you human.

586
00:58:31,886 --> 00:58:35,390
-Why?
-We need to be like you.

587
00:58:36,224 --> 00:58:38,393
I understand you now.

588
00:58:38,393 --> 00:58:42,022
I remember that which you do
not, what you've been missing.

589
00:58:42,063 --> 00:58:47,569
The ocean, yes? Running along
the waves as a child.

590
00:58:47,610 --> 00:58:52,157
Meeting Emma at the river,
that first kiss that followed.

591
00:58:53,116 --> 00:58:56,244
-What are you?
-You've seen what we are.

592
00:58:56,286 --> 00:58:58,872
We use your dead as vessels.

593
01:01:08,668 --> 01:01:09,669
Get in!

594
01:01:25,185 --> 01:01:29,105
-What about her? Ring a bell?
-She was alive when I left her.

595
01:01:29,105 --> 01:01:32,192
-What about this?
-This is nothing.

596
01:01:32,233 --> 01:01:34,444
It must mean something--
all those pictures.

597
01:01:34,444 --> 01:01:35,487
What pictures?

598
01:01:36,946 --> 01:01:39,824
-I don't understand this.
-Stop playing games with me.

599
01:01:39,866 --> 01:01:42,327
-Stop telling me lies.
-I am not telling lies!

600
01:01:42,369 --> 01:01:44,704
Help me out.
Make me understand.

601
01:01:44,746 --> 01:01:49,709
I have this jigsaw puzzle in
my face, and it makes no sense.

602
01:01:49,751 --> 01:01:53,088
You think it makes sense to me?
I'm as confused as you are.

603
01:01:53,129 --> 01:01:57,092
Let me ask you a question.
Have you heard of Shell Beach?

604
01:01:57,092 --> 01:01:59,260
-Sure.
-You know how to get there?

605
01:01:59,260 --> 01:02:00,970
-Yeah.
-Tell me.

606
01:02:01,513 --> 01:02:06,810
-Right. You just go to the...
-Where? Where do you go?

607
01:02:06,810 --> 01:02:08,478
Give me a second, will you?

608
01:02:10,438 --> 01:02:12,023
You can't remember, can you?

609
01:02:13,441 --> 01:02:15,944
Thinking that's kind of odd?

610
01:02:17,153 --> 01:02:19,239
Wait. I got a better one.

611
01:02:19,280 --> 01:02:23,034
When was the last time you
did something during the day?

612
01:02:23,660 --> 01:02:26,621
-What do you mean?
-I just mean during the day.

613
01:02:27,831 --> 01:02:30,583
Daylight. When was the last
time you remember seeing it?

614
01:02:30,625 --> 01:02:34,337
I'm not talking about a distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

615
01:02:34,379 --> 01:02:37,173
I mean, like, yesterday.
Last week? When?

616
01:02:38,091 --> 01:02:39,843
Do you have a single memory?

617
01:02:41,678 --> 01:02:43,388
You don't, do you?

618
01:02:43,388 --> 01:02:48,935
I don't think the sun
even exists in this place.

619
01:02:49,019 --> 01:02:53,189
'Cause I've been up for hours
and hours, and night never ends.

620
01:02:53,773 --> 01:02:56,067
-That's crazy.
-You're damn right it's crazy.

621
01:02:56,109 --> 01:02:59,696
But listen to me, Bumstead.
It's not just me.

622
01:02:59,738 --> 01:03:02,657
It's all of us. They're doing
something to all of us.

623
01:03:02,699 --> 01:03:04,576
Shut up.
I've heard enough.

624
01:03:04,576 --> 01:03:07,328
-Please listen--
-Shut up!

625
01:03:17,756 --> 01:03:20,592
There has to be an explanation.

626
01:03:27,974 --> 01:03:28,933
Explain this.

627
01:03:50,789 --> 01:03:52,290
I'm so sorry.

628
01:03:53,375 --> 01:03:56,336
I never meant to hurt you.
I don't know why I did.

629
01:03:56,336 --> 01:03:58,171
I wish I could take it back.

630
01:03:58,838 --> 01:04:01,174
You didn't do it.

631
01:04:01,174 --> 01:04:02,884
This affair of yours,

632
01:04:02,926 --> 01:04:06,012
whatever you think you've done,
you didn't do it.

633
01:04:06,054 --> 01:04:07,222
I don't believe it happened.

634
01:04:07,263 --> 01:04:11,059
-What do you mean?
-This will sound crazy.

635
01:04:11,101 --> 01:04:14,270
What if we never knew
each other before now?

636
01:04:14,270 --> 01:04:20,527
What if the first time we met
was last night in our apartment?

637
01:04:20,568 --> 01:04:23,321
And everything you remember,

638
01:04:23,363 --> 01:04:26,574
and everything I'm supposed to
remember never really happened.

639
01:04:26,616 --> 01:04:29,077
Someone just wants us
to think it did.

640
01:04:30,036 --> 01:04:31,538
But how can that be true?

641
01:04:32,163 --> 01:04:35,166
I so vividly remember
meeting you.

642
01:04:36,459 --> 01:04:38,837
I remember falling in love
with you.

643
01:04:40,422 --> 01:04:43,425
-I remember losing you.
-Time's up.

644
01:04:44,968 --> 01:04:49,806
No, wait, please.
Just one more minute.

645
01:04:56,312 --> 01:04:57,814
I love you, John.

646
01:05:01,192 --> 01:05:03,361
You can't fake something
like that.

647
01:05:05,071 --> 01:05:06,573
No, you can't.

648
01:05:35,894 --> 01:05:38,438
Inspector? Sir?

649
01:05:39,856 --> 01:05:42,567
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

650
01:05:44,903 --> 01:05:46,321
I thought you should know.

651
01:05:48,948 --> 01:05:53,286
The chief wanted to see you.
Sir?

652
01:06:00,210 --> 01:06:02,087
I knew you'd track
the killer down.

653
01:06:17,644 --> 01:06:18,770
Shoelace.

654
01:06:31,950 --> 01:06:35,120
-How can we help you, sir?
-You can sleep.

655
01:06:38,540 --> 01:06:40,250
Sleep. Sleep.

656
01:06:44,004 --> 01:06:45,171
Evening.

657
01:06:58,059 --> 01:07:01,688
I wanted to be the first to
congratulate you about the case.

658
01:07:04,274 --> 01:07:07,110
Take us to Murdoch.

659
01:07:07,110 --> 01:07:08,111
Sleep.

660
01:07:38,641 --> 01:07:40,268
I knew you'd come eventually.

661
01:07:40,310 --> 01:07:42,812
Isn't it time
you gave me some answers?

662
01:07:44,147 --> 01:07:46,858
Yes, of course.
Won't you please sit down?

663
01:07:50,153 --> 01:07:52,030
I come here often.

664
01:07:52,072 --> 01:07:54,616
It's one of the few places
I'm allowed some peace.

665
01:07:55,075 --> 01:07:58,119
You see, they have
an aversion to water.

666
01:07:59,120 --> 01:08:01,122
One could almost call it
a phobia.

667
01:08:01,581 --> 01:08:04,209
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

668
01:08:04,250 --> 01:08:05,251
Right.

669
01:08:05,960 --> 01:08:10,674
For now, let's say you're
the subject of their experiment.

670
01:08:10,715 --> 01:08:12,175
We all are.

671
01:08:13,843 --> 01:08:19,724
I'm sorry, but I have no time
to do this the right way.

672
01:08:19,724 --> 01:08:23,728
Everything you need to know
is in this syringe.

673
01:08:23,770 --> 01:08:27,357
I need you to inject yourself.
It's the only way to understand.

674
01:08:27,399 --> 01:08:30,235
-You're kidding, right?
-We're running out of time!

675
01:08:30,276 --> 01:08:33,905
-You have to do this now.
-Give me the gun.

676
01:08:33,947 --> 01:08:36,116
He's more disturbed
than we thought.

677
01:08:36,157 --> 01:08:39,035
I may not be the judge
of personality you are,

678
01:08:39,077 --> 01:08:42,038
but you're the one
who looks disturbed.

679
01:08:42,080 --> 01:08:44,582
You don't know what
you're doing.

680
01:08:45,792 --> 01:08:49,754
What exactly is in this, Doctor?

681
01:08:51,423 --> 01:08:54,592
All the answers you've been
looking for, I swear to you.

682
01:08:56,511 --> 01:09:02,308
Guess I'll hold on to it for
safekeeping, if you don't mind.

683
01:09:02,308 --> 01:09:03,643
Let's go, Doctor.

684
01:09:05,186 --> 01:09:08,356
Go? Where are we going?

685
01:09:08,815 --> 01:09:10,525
Shell Beach.

686
01:09:11,651 --> 01:09:15,113
That's where you wanted to go,
isn't it, the ocean?

687
01:09:23,955 --> 01:09:27,375
Won't find anything there.
I've been there--

688
01:09:27,417 --> 01:09:29,753
Then you can show us the way.

689
01:09:29,794 --> 01:09:33,506
I won't. I refuse.
You can't make me go there.

690
01:09:33,506 --> 01:09:35,925
Don't you understand?
They'll be waiting for us.

691
01:09:45,226 --> 01:09:49,731
I don't understand.
There used to be a bridge here.

692
01:09:55,111 --> 01:09:58,198
Try that again, and your friends
will find you in the canal.

693
01:09:58,239 --> 01:10:00,033
Don't hurt me.
I'll tell you everything.

694
01:10:00,075 --> 01:10:01,826
It doesn't matter anymore
anyway.

695
01:10:08,708 --> 01:10:09,709
What?

696
01:10:13,088 --> 01:10:14,631
Who are you people?

697
01:10:15,090 --> 01:10:17,842
Must go to the end
of the canal.

698
01:10:19,135 --> 01:10:21,805
We will give you some more
pretty things soon...

699
01:10:22,972 --> 01:10:25,308
-Anna.
-I'm not Anna.

700
01:10:26,976 --> 01:10:28,978
You will be soon, yes.

701
01:10:33,274 --> 01:10:36,111
I have another use
for her first.

702
01:10:45,620 --> 01:10:47,497
I call them Strangers.

703
01:10:48,081 --> 01:10:50,542
They abducted us
and brought us here.

704
01:10:51,710 --> 01:10:56,172
This city, everyone in it...
is their experiment.

705
01:10:56,172 --> 01:10:58,883
They mix and match our memories
as they see fit,

706
01:10:58,925 --> 01:11:01,594
trying to divine
what makes us unique.

707
01:11:02,095 --> 01:11:04,931
One day, a man might be
an inspector.

708
01:11:05,015 --> 01:11:07,767
The next,
someone entirely different.

709
01:11:08,184 --> 01:11:11,604
When they want to study
a murderer, for instance,

710
01:11:11,604 --> 01:11:16,109
they simply imprint one of their
citizens with a new personality.

711
01:11:16,109 --> 01:11:20,405
Arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

712
01:11:20,447 --> 01:11:22,323
even a lost wallet.

713
01:11:22,365 --> 01:11:24,492
Then they observe the results.

714
01:11:25,744 --> 01:11:29,914
Will a man, given the history of
a killer, continue in that vein?

715
01:11:30,415 --> 01:11:34,002
Or are we, in fact, more than
the sum of our memories?

716
01:11:34,044 --> 01:11:38,590
This business of you being
a killer was a sad coincidence.

717
01:11:39,257 --> 01:11:41,843
You have had dozens of lives
before now.

718
01:11:41,926 --> 01:11:43,303
You happened to wake up...

719
01:11:43,345 --> 01:11:46,181
while I was imprinting you
with this one.

720
01:11:46,264 --> 01:11:48,183
Why are they doing all this?

721
01:11:48,308 --> 01:11:52,437
It is our capacity for
individuality, our souls...

722
01:11:52,479 --> 01:11:54,314
that makes us different
from them.

723
01:11:54,314 --> 01:11:56,816
They think they'll find
the human soul...

724
01:11:56,816 --> 01:11:59,527
if they understand
how our memories work.

725
01:11:59,527 --> 01:12:04,032
They have collective memories.
They share one group mind.

726
01:12:04,074 --> 01:12:08,953
They're dying. Their race is
on the brink of extinction.

727
01:12:08,995 --> 01:12:11,998
-They think we can save them.
-Where do I fit in?

728
01:12:12,040 --> 01:12:16,586
You're different. You resisted
my attempt to imprint you.

729
01:12:21,508 --> 01:12:25,011
Somehow, you have developed
their ability to Tune.

730
01:12:25,011 --> 01:12:28,264
That is how they change things,
how they built this city.

731
01:12:28,348 --> 01:12:31,226
They have machines buried
beneath the surface...

732
01:12:31,226 --> 01:12:34,771
that allow them to focus
their telepathic energies.

733
01:12:35,563 --> 01:12:38,191
They control everything here,
even the sun.

734
01:12:38,233 --> 01:12:41,403
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

735
01:12:41,444 --> 01:12:42,904
Why do they need you?

736
01:12:42,946 --> 01:12:44,906
When they first brought us here,

737
01:12:44,906 --> 01:12:49,244
they extracted what was in us
and stored the information,

738
01:12:49,285 --> 01:12:51,204
remixed it like paint...

739
01:12:51,246 --> 01:12:53,748
and gave us back
new memories of their choosing.

740
01:12:53,790 --> 01:12:57,419
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

741
01:12:59,170 --> 01:13:04,134
I understood the human mind
better than they ever could,

742
01:13:04,175 --> 01:13:07,804
so they allowed me to keep
my skills as a scientist...

743
01:13:07,804 --> 01:13:09,305
because they needed them.

744
01:13:09,305 --> 01:13:11,766
They made me delete
everything else.

745
01:13:20,358 --> 01:13:24,821
Can you imagine what it's like
to erase your own past?

746
01:13:24,863 --> 01:13:28,116
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

747
01:13:28,992 --> 01:13:31,077
Shell Beach. Uncle Karl.

748
01:13:32,287 --> 01:13:36,374
What about this?
This was blank when I found it.

749
01:13:36,416 --> 01:13:40,295
You still don't understand.
You were never a boy.

750
01:13:40,337 --> 01:13:41,671
Not in this place.

751
01:13:41,671 --> 01:13:44,549
Your history is an illusion,
a fabrication,

752
01:13:44,591 --> 01:13:46,426
as it is with all of us.

753
01:13:46,509 --> 01:13:49,012
You made those drawings happen
with your gift.

754
01:13:49,012 --> 01:13:50,555
You say they brought us here.

755
01:13:52,891 --> 01:13:53,892
From where?

756
01:13:57,771 --> 01:14:00,940
I'm sorry. I don't remember.

757
01:14:01,775 --> 01:14:06,029
None of us remember that...
what we once were...

758
01:14:06,071 --> 01:14:09,616
what we might have been...
somewhere else.

759
01:14:27,425 --> 01:14:31,179
I've taken you this far.
You don't need me anymore.

760
01:14:31,262 --> 01:14:32,180
Let's go.

761
01:15:17,684 --> 01:15:19,894
There is no ocean, John.

762
01:15:21,229 --> 01:15:23,356
There's nothing beyond the city.

763
01:15:24,941 --> 01:15:27,444
The only place home exists...

764
01:15:29,696 --> 01:15:31,281
is in your head.

765
01:15:42,709 --> 01:15:43,710
Stop!

766
01:15:56,806 --> 01:15:57,807
Please!

767
01:16:18,703 --> 01:16:20,830
Now you know the truth.

768
01:17:20,473 --> 01:17:23,143
You'll allow yourself
to surrender...

769
01:17:23,143 --> 01:17:25,478
or it will result in
this one's death.

770
01:17:25,478 --> 01:17:26,688
What do I care?

771
01:17:27,188 --> 01:17:29,274
She's not my real wife.
She's nothing to me.

772
01:17:29,315 --> 01:17:33,987
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

773
01:17:34,029 --> 01:17:38,283
I have become the monster
you were intended to be.

774
01:17:40,243 --> 01:17:43,788
Shall I end her life now,
as you would have?

775
01:17:47,334 --> 01:17:52,672
-Don't hurt her, please.
-Then surrender.

776
01:17:54,841 --> 01:17:55,842
Sleep.

777
01:17:58,011 --> 01:17:58,928
Now.

778
01:18:18,281 --> 01:18:19,282
Sleep.

779
01:18:28,333 --> 01:18:29,709
Kill him.

780
01:18:29,751 --> 01:18:30,752
Kill him !

781
01:18:41,304 --> 01:18:44,808
He is powerful, yes, dangerous.

782
01:18:44,808 --> 01:18:48,144
But he can also lead us
to what we seek...

783
01:18:48,186 --> 01:18:51,356
what the doctor calls the soul.

784
01:18:51,439 --> 01:18:55,360
It is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

785
01:18:55,443 --> 01:18:58,238
We no longer need
the other subjects.

786
01:18:58,279 --> 01:19:01,658
The time for study is over.

787
01:19:01,658 --> 01:19:05,995
It is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

788
01:19:12,836 --> 01:19:16,172
It is time, Doctor. Imprint.

789
01:19:18,842 --> 01:19:21,011
Shut it down!

790
01:19:21,928 --> 01:19:24,389
Shut it down forever.

791
01:19:39,029 --> 01:19:40,113
What are you doing?

792
01:19:41,031 --> 01:19:45,744
They want to imprint you with
their own collective memories.

793
01:19:46,828 --> 01:19:49,039
They want to make you
one of them...

794
01:19:49,080 --> 01:19:51,249
so they can share your soul.

795
01:19:51,291 --> 01:19:53,626
But I've got other plans.

796
01:19:57,005 --> 01:19:59,924
Imprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

797
01:19:59,924 --> 01:20:04,596
I'm sorry. The pain will
only last a moment.

798
01:20:15,690 --> 01:20:17,442
Remember, John.

799
01:20:18,443 --> 01:20:20,487
You'll rise to greater heights
than that.

800
01:20:20,528 --> 01:20:22,989
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

801
01:20:24,324 --> 01:20:25,283
Remember.

802
01:20:26,659 --> 01:20:29,496
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

803
01:20:29,537 --> 01:20:32,791
Now, remember what I told you.
Never talk to strangers.

804
01:20:33,166 --> 01:20:34,501
John, remember.

805
01:20:34,709 --> 01:20:37,504
You're probably wondering why I
keep appearing in your memories.

806
01:20:37,545 --> 01:20:40,006
It's because I have
inserted myself in them.

807
01:20:40,006 --> 01:20:44,010
They were fabricated to
teach you about the Strangers.

808
01:20:44,010 --> 01:20:47,180
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

809
01:20:50,016 --> 01:20:54,688
You will survive, John. You'll
find strength within yourself.

810
01:20:54,729 --> 01:20:56,272
And you will prevail.

811
01:20:56,940 --> 01:20:58,066
Remember.

812
01:20:58,775 --> 01:21:01,027
-Hi, Uncle Karl.
-Johnny!

813
01:21:03,947 --> 01:21:08,076
Getting the hang of it, John.
Maybe one day I'll work for you.

814
01:21:08,702 --> 01:21:12,330
Here's the machine the Strangers
use to amplify their thoughts,

815
01:21:12,372 --> 01:21:14,124
the machine that changes
their world.

816
01:21:14,165 --> 01:21:17,419
You must take control of it.
You must make the machine yours.

817
01:21:17,460 --> 01:21:22,090
I know you can beat them,
but you must concentrate.

818
01:21:24,092 --> 01:21:25,301
Something's wrong.

819
01:21:34,144 --> 01:21:35,979
There is no time for romance.

820
01:21:36,021 --> 01:21:38,148
The world can be
what you make it.

821
01:21:39,149 --> 01:21:40,191
What have you done?

822
01:21:41,317 --> 01:21:43,445
You have the power
to make anything happen...

823
01:21:43,528 --> 01:21:45,447
but you must act now.

824
01:26:30,023 --> 01:26:34,277
I knew you could do it, John.
You have their power now.

825
01:26:34,361 --> 01:26:36,613
-You control their machines.
-Where's Emma?

826
01:26:37,781 --> 01:26:42,243
She's not Emma anymore.
She has been reimprinted.

827
01:26:42,243 --> 01:26:44,537
-So give her back her memories.
-I can't.

828
01:26:44,579 --> 01:26:48,667
The facility where they stored
the memories has been destroyed.

829
01:26:49,459 --> 01:26:50,460
I'm sorry.

830
01:26:51,878 --> 01:26:53,838
What are you going to do now?

831
01:26:56,841 --> 01:26:58,343
I'm gonna fix things.

832
01:26:59,969 --> 01:27:03,306
You told me I had the power,
didn't you?

833
01:27:04,265 --> 01:27:07,185
I can make these machines
do anything I want.

834
01:27:08,269 --> 01:27:10,313
Make this world
anything I want it to be.

835
01:27:11,523 --> 01:27:15,610
Just so long as I concentrate
hard enough.

836
01:28:39,361 --> 01:28:40,612
Where are you going?

837
01:28:44,074 --> 01:28:45,075
Shell Beach.

838
01:29:26,491 --> 01:29:27,992
-What's the fare?
-A quarter.

839
01:29:34,749 --> 01:29:36,501
-Please.
-Oh, no, sit.

840
01:29:37,794 --> 01:29:38,795
Thank you.

841
01:30:24,841 --> 01:30:26,843
Been waiting for you, yes?

842
01:30:27,510 --> 01:30:31,848
-What are you doing?
-I'm just making a few changes.

843
01:30:31,890 --> 01:30:36,770
-We're sure that's what we want?
-I'll take my chances.

844
01:30:36,853 --> 01:30:42,609
I'm dying, John. Your imprint
is not agreeable with my kind.

845
01:30:42,692 --> 01:30:44,861
But I wanted to know
what it was like.

846
01:30:46,571 --> 01:30:48,198
How you feel.

847
01:30:48,281 --> 01:30:50,950
You know how I was
supposed to feel.

848
01:30:50,992 --> 01:30:55,080
That person isn't me.
Never was.

849
01:30:55,121 --> 01:30:58,333
You wanted to know what it was
that makes us human.

850
01:30:59,417 --> 01:31:03,213
Well, you're not going to
find it in here.

851
01:31:04,839 --> 01:31:06,633
You went looking
in the wrong place.

852
01:32:45,982 --> 01:32:47,776
It's so beautiful here.

853
01:32:53,239 --> 01:32:54,491
So bright.

854
01:33:00,789 --> 01:33:02,832
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

855
01:33:03,583 --> 01:33:05,960
I think that's it over there.

856
01:33:24,229 --> 01:33:26,231
I'm headed that way myself.

857
01:33:28,233 --> 01:33:29,567
Would you like to join me?

858
01:33:32,737 --> 01:33:33,697
Sure.

859
01:33:39,160 --> 01:33:42,706
I'm Anna, by the way.
What's your name?
